question_text: A technician suspects a failed backlight inverter in a CCFL-based laptop. What observation best supports this diagnosis?
answer_options: Display is completely dead, with no image visible even under a flashlight
The screen works intermittently, especially when pressure is applied to the lid
The display is dark, but an image is visible when illuminated externally
The screen shows vertical lines and random colors
correct_answer: The display is dark, but an image is visible when illuminated externally
explanation: If the LCD image is visible under external light, the screen and GPU are functioning, but the backlight — powered by the inverter in CCFL systems — is likely dead.
